meanings.definition: The quality or state of being leisurely.
meanings.sent1: Her leisureliness was evident as she strolled through the park without a care in the world.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the leisureliness of a lazy Sunday afternoon, just relaxing and unwinding.
meanings.sent3: The cat's leisureliness in stretching out on the sunny windowsill always brings a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: The leisureliness of the river's flow reminded me to slow down and appreciate the beauty around me.
meanings.sent5: The leisureliness of the old oak tree's branches swaying in the breeze was a calming sight.

meanings.definition: The act of taking one's time or moving slowly.
meanings.sent1: His leisureliness in completing the task annoyed his coworkers who preferred a faster pace.
meanings.sent2: The leisureliness of the elderly couple walking hand in hand was heartwarming to see.
meanings.sent3: The snail's leisureliness in crossing the sidewalk caused a traffic jam of ants trying to pass.
meanings.sent4: The leisureliness of the tortoise in the race proved that slow and steady can win the race.
meanings.sent5: The leisureliness of the sloth hanging from the tree branch was a lesson in patience and relaxation.
